dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You know, I was just thinking about international travel, but not the fun kind.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, I was just thinking about international travel, but not the fun kind.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, like prisoner transfers? Because, uh, the Senate just ratified that agreement between Kazakhstan and Cyprus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, like prisoner transfers? Because, uh, the Senate just ratified that agreement between Kazakhstan and Cyprus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Senate deputies ratified agreements between Kazakhstan and Cyprus on the transfer of convicted persons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, signed in Astana back in March of last year. It's all about letting convicted persons serve their sentences in their home countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, signed in Astana back in March of last year. It's all about letting convicted persons serve their sentences in their home countries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The agreement was signed in Astana in March last year. "In accordance with the agreement, the parties undertake to transfer to each other convicted persons who have been sentenced to imprisonment so that they can continue serving their sentence or the remainder of it in their country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so if you're a Kazakh citizen imprisoned in Cyprus, you could potentially be transferred back to finish your sentence there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so if you're a Kazakh citizen imprisoned in Cyprus, you could potentially be transferred back to finish your sentence there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the Prosecutor General's Office in Kazakhstan is the one handling their side of things, which makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Prosecutor General's Office in Kazakhstan is the one handling their side of things, which makes sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Prosecutor General's Office has been determined as the body responsible from Kazakhstan for the execution of decisions on the transfer of convicted persons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not a free-for-all. There are some pretty strict grounds for refusal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not a free-for-all. There are some pretty strict grounds for refusal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Like, if the transfer could threaten national security or public order for the sentencing country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Like, if the transfer could threaten national security or public order for the sentencing country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, the transfer may be refused if it may harm the sovereignty, security or public order of the country that issued the sentence, if the convicted person has not compensated for the damages ordered by the court, and also if the person is still being prosecuted in the country that issued the sentence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Or if the convicted person hasn't paid their court-ordered damages yet. That's a big one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or if the convicted person hasn't paid their court-ordered damages yet. That's a big one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, the transfer may be refused if it may harm the sovereignty, security or public order of the country that issued the sentence, if the convicted person has not compensated for the damages ordered by the court, and also if the person is still being prosecuted in the country that issued the sentence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And also if they're still facing other charges in that country. They're not just gonna let someone skip out on an ongoing trial.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And also if they're still facing other charges in that country. They're not just gonna let someone skip out on an ongoing trial.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, the transfer may be refused if it may harm the sovereignty, security or public order of the country that issued the sentence, if the convicted person has not compensated for the damages ordered by the court, and also if the person is still being prosecuted in the country that issued the sentence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting that this came out of the Cypriot Foreign Minister's official visit to Astana.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting that this came out of the Cypriot Foreign Minister's official visit to Astana.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On March 25, in Astana, as part of the official visit of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Cyprus to Kazakhstan, a ceremony was held to sign an agreement between the two countries on the transfer of convicted persons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Senator Sovetbek Medebayev was the one who laid out all the details for the ratification.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Senator Sovetbek Medebayev was the one who laid out all the details for the ratification.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "The agreement establishes specific grounds for both the transfer of convicted persons and for refusing to do so," said Senator Sovetbek Medebayev.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It seems like a very practical agreement, honestly. Helps with prison overcrowding and reintegration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It seems like a very practical agreement, honestly. Helps with prison overcrowding and reintegration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And it gives people a chance to be closer to family while serving their time, which can help with rehabilitation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And it gives people a chance to be closer to family while serving their time, which can help with rehabilitation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: As long as all the legal boxes are checked, it sounds like a positive step for both countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: As long as all the legal boxes are checked, it sounds like a positive step for both countries.
